input2:
___ with metastatic ovarian cancer treated one month ago with___ presents with progressive abdominal pain, nausea and inability to tolerate oral intake. 

The patient complains of progressive mid-epigastric abdominal pain that radiates to her chest and is exacerbate with eating food and noted to be worse in the morning. This pain has
progressed since getting chemotherapy and she has been unable to reliably take adequate PO intake. She has been administering IV infusions of normal saline, up to two liters per day at home without improvement of her symptoms.

She also notes occasional chills but no fevers. Last bowel movement was this morning.

She has no headache but endorses dizziness. No chest pain or
dyspnea. No vomiting or diarrhea. No melena, hemotochezia or
dysuria.
input3:
- Ovarian carcinoma as above
- Gastritis
- Nontoxic unilateral nodular goiter
- Schistosomiasis
- Fibroids
- Migraine with aura
- Low back pain
- Generalized anxiety disorder
- Alcohol abuse
- Vitamin D deficiency
input4:
- Maternal grandmother with breast cancer in ___
- Maternal aunt with breast cancer in ___
- No history of gynecologic or colonic malignancies
